title: How Questions Over a Spy Balloon and U.F.O.s Fed a Crisis Between the U.S. and China
description: U.S. officials now suspect that the balloon was sent to spy on bases in Guam and Hawaii and that recent U.F.O.s were not surveillance machines. Washington’s evolving view reflects U.S. and Chinese difficulties in discerning each other’s intentions.

title: Who Was Pablo Neruda and Why Is His Death a Mystery?
description: After a decade-long investigation, a team of forensic experts issued their final report on the exhumed remains of the acclaimed Chilean poet. Here’s why there are so many questions around his death.

title: Was Pablo Neruda Murdered?
description: There has long been suspicion that Chile’s military dictatorship poisoned the nation’s most famous poet. A decade-long investigation has produced tantalizing clues, but nothing more.

title: Hans Modrow, 95, Dies; One of East Germany’s Last Communist Leaders
description: He became prime minister less than two weeks after the fall of the Berlin Wall, and initially sought to preserve East Germany before accepting reunification.

title: Corruption Trial of Mexico Ex-Lawman Goes to Jury
description: As the case of Genaro García Luna, Mexico’s former top security official, ended with closing statements, the jury will consider the credibility of criminals who testified against him.

title: Nicola Sturgeon Resignation Hints at Shifting Norms for Women
description: In announcing her plans to leave office, Nicola Sturgeon spoke to Scots about the personal toll being in politics can take.

title: Nicola Sturgeon Resigns as Scotland’s First Minister, Citing Toll of the Job
description: Nicola Sturgeon’s resignation removes one of the most formidable figures from British politics, one who has dedicated her life to the cause of Scottish independence.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: 1.5 Million Covid Deaths in China?
description: Also, Scotland’s leader resigns and Air India orders a record 470 planes.

title: World Bank President, Dogged by Climate Questions, Steps Down Early
description: David Malpass, under fire for months by critics who called him a climate denier, said he will step down as president, leaving a year before his term ends.

title: What Toxic Chemicals Were Aboard the Derailed Train in Ohio?
description: The train was carrying industrial materials used in plastics, paint thinners and other products, according to information provided to the federal government.

title: Israeli Parliament Votes to Deport Citizens Convicted of Terrorism
description: Amid a surge in violence, lawmakers voted to allow the authorities to deport convicted Palestinians, including Israeli citizens. Opponents called the law, aimed at Arabs, discriminatory.

title: Before Stepping Down, Nicola Sturgeon Faced a Battle Over Transgender Rights
description: The fight didn’t propel Nicola Sturgeon to resign, she said, but it did lead to a clash with the British government.

title: Small English Town Gets Musical in Search for New Doctor
description: The Cornish village of Lostwithiel is looking for a new general practitioner amid a national shortage of primary care doctors. They hope a music video will do the trick.

title: Thief Steals Nearly 200,000 Cadbury Creme Eggs in Britain
description: Unable to resist jokes, the police credited themselves with having “helped save Easter” by solving the “eggs-travagent” crime.

title: Two Teenagers Charged in Murder of Brianna Ghey in England
description: The police said two 15-year-olds were charged with murder on Wednesday after Brianna Ghey, a transgender 16-year-old, was found fatally stabbed in a park.

title: Who Could Replace Nicola Sturgeon as Scotland’s First Minister?
description: Ms. Sturgeon’s party, the Scottish National Party, is expected to hold an election to choose her successor in the coming weeks.

title: Heavy Losses Renew Questions About Russia Sustaining Its Offensive
description: The fighting has also come at a cost for Ukraine, which is expending vast amounts of ammunition to repel Russia’s growing numbers of ground troops,

title: Scientists Get a Close-Up Look Beneath a Troubling Ice Shelf in Antarctica
description: A robot lowered through the ice reveals how the Thwaites shelf is melting, which will help forecast its effect on global sea level.

title: China Says U.S. Flew Balloons Over Xinjiang and Tibet
description: The accusation came days after Beijing claimed that the United States had sent airships over China multiple times, ramping up tensions between the two superpowers.

title: How Does Scotland Fit Into the UK Government?
description: In Scotland, the government makes decisions relating to the economy, education, health, justice and other areas.

title: In Turkey After the Earthquake, Hope Fades for Waiting Families
description: Residents of Adiyaman, hit hard by the quake, hold impromptu vigils while they await news of relatives still under the rubble, feeding wood from shattered cupboards into fires to keep warm.

title: 6,000 Ukrainian Children Are Being Held in Russian Camps, Report Finds
description: Children as young as four months old are being held in “integration programs” designed to Russify them, according to researchers.

title: Syrians in Hard-Hit Areas of Turkey Rush to Border to Return Home
description: In Turkey, officials said that rescue efforts were focused on several hundred buildings where there was a chance of finding any survivors.

title: Scotland’s Leader Nicola Sturgeon Says She Will Step Down in Surprise Move
description: Ms. Sturgeon, a longtime champion of Scottish independence, has been first minister since 2014.

title: Pace of Fighting Trains Focus on Ammunition Supplies
description: As Ukraine’s NATO allies strategize in Brussels, and Russia turns to Iran, the next phase of the war could turn on which side rearms faster. Here’s what we’re covering:

title: Diversity vs. Fairness
description: When the Supreme Court upheld affirmative action in the 1970s, it helped lay the groundwork for the program’s demise.

title: Captain of Thai Soccer Team Who Survived Cave Rescue Dies in England
description: Duangpetch Promthep, 17, was a member of the soccer team that made an extraordinary escape from a submerged cave in Thailand in 2018. The cause of his death was unclear.

title: Who Is Nicola Sturgeon, Scotland’s Longest-Serving First Minister?
description: Nicola Sturgeon, a powerful voice for Scottish independence, rose through her party’s ranks to become the most prominent figure in Scottish politics.

title: Thousands of Syrian Refugees in Turkey Rush to Border Crossing to Return Home
description: The Syrian administration of a key border crossing into opposition-held territory in northwestern Syria said on social media that Turkey would allow Syrians to leave the country and then return. Thousands flocked to that and other crossings.

title: In Bleak Russian Cemetery, Sea of Crosses Signals War’s True Toll
description: A dismal, snowy plot near the Black Sea is the final resting place for more and more soldiers from the Wagner mercenary forces, a testament to the huge casualties Russia is suffering in its invasion.

title: Scotland’s Leader Nicola Sturgeon to Step Down, Media Reports Say
description: Ms. Sturgeon, a longtime champion of Scottish independence, has been first minister since 2014.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Rescues in Turkey against the odds.

title: As Taliban Settle In, Kabul’s Green Zone Comes Back to Life
description: Walking down its streets a year ago was like wandering into the modern ruins of another empire come and gone from Afghanistan. Now, the Taliban have adopted the former diplomatic enclave as their own.

title: How Climate Change Is Spreading Malaria in Africa
description: The mosquitoes that transmit the disease dramatically increased their range over the last century as temperatures warmed, scientists reported.
